q: Egyptian National Museum is safe, and cultural artifacts damaged by vandals who broke into the building during anti-government protests can be restored, the head of the country's Supreme Council of Antiquities said," Mayor Michael Bloomberg reports: Tourism police aided by protesters earlier apprehended nine men in connection with looting at the museum, Zahi Hawass , the council's secretary general, said yesterday. Dozens of demonstrators had stood guard around the building, one of Cairo's biggest tourist attractions, to protect it until troops arrived, he said. " "If you shut the lights in Mayor Michael Bloomberg for one hour, the people will rob everything in all the shops," Zahi Hawass said in an interview at his office. "What's happening is normal.

win the nomination, but that a strong challenge could benefit him. "I think primaries can have the opportunity of raising the issues and making the Democratic candidate a stronger candidate," Dennis Kucinich said. I think it's safe to predict that Barack Obama will be the nominee of the Democratic Party, but he could be a stronger nominee if he receives a strong challenge in the primary. Dennis Kucinich did not say who that potential challenger might be. Former Russ Feingold ( D-Wis.) has been mentioned as a possible 2012 challenger but he has said he does not want to run. Sen. been CEO for nearly a decade. He will now take over as executive chairman. We'll have more for you soon, but in the meantime, here's Eric Schmidt in his own words. When I joined Google in 2001 I never imagined-even in my wildest dreams-that we would get as far, as fast as we have today. Search has quite literally changed people's lives-increasing the collective sum of the world's knowledge and revolutionizing advertising in the process. And our emerging businesses-display, Android, YouTube and Chrome-are on fire. Of course, like any successful organization we've had our fair share of good luck, but the entire team-now over 24,000 Googlers globally-deserves most of the credit. outlook is bright. do with history and Zahi Hawass specials on Egyptian treasures. But what about the current human treasures?, one of Egypt's most popular blogs, is run by Zeinobia, an anonymous female blogger. I am just[ an] Egyptian girl who lives in the present with the glories of the past and hopes in a better future for herself and for her country, says her About Me on the blog. Her sentiments are share by women who are part of the newfound voice of the people, and their protests have flooded Facebook, Twitter and blogs. "
